p: Now we draw on a recent example of critical pedagogy which sought to incorporate the principles of relational practice and connectedness during the COVID-19 pandemic. At the University of the Sunshine Coast, non-traditional social work placements in the form of online student units were set up to provide alternate field education placement opportunities for students. Simultaneously, an action-research project with the placement students as co-researchers was conducted to explore students’ learning experiences in student units and how they were developing a social work identity under the new conditions effected by COVID-19. A student unit is defined as a group of supervised students placed at one institution or organization to work collaboratively on a particular task or project. Student units provide students with a network of colleagues through which to engage in collective learning processes (Anand, 2007).
